title: Extraordinary reporting requirements
context: ยง489D-14 Extraordinary reporting requirements. Within fifteen business days of the occurrence of any one of the events listed below, a licensee shall file a written report with the commissioner describing the event and its expected impact on the licensee&rsquo;s activities in this State. These events are: (1) Any material change in information provided in a licensee&rsquo;s application or annual report; (2) The filing for bankruptcy or reorganization by the licensee; (3) Pending or final revocation, suspension, or other enforcement action against the licensee by any state or governmental authority relating to the licensee&rsquo;s money transmission activities; (4) Any felony indictment of the licensee or any of its key shareholders, principals, executive officers, or officers or managers in charge of the licensee&rsquo;s activities, related to money transmission activities; and (5) Any felony conviction of the licensee or any of its key shareholders, principals, executive officers, or officers or managers in charge of the licensee&rsquo;s activities, related to money transmission activities. [L 2006, c 153, pt of ยง1; am L 2008, c 195, ยง9]
